intro: Onosuris acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed onosuris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with a pointed tip. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a tubular corolla. Onosuris acuminata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
